subject: Communication
title: Hearing vs. Listening: The Critical Difference
description: A 60-second lesson on Hearing vs. Listening: The Critical Difference.

hook.text: Your ears are always on. You hear 24/7 â€” even while sleeping. But listening?

buildup.text: Hearing is a passive physiological process. Sound waves enter the ear, vibrate tiny bones, and trigger nerve signals.

discovery.text: Listening is an active cognitive process: selecting, attending, understanding, evaluating, and remembering.

twist.text: Studies show we retain only 25-50% of what we hear. That means in a 10-minute conversation, we miss half the message.

climax.text: The gap between hearing and listening is where most communication failures occur.

punchline.text: Hearing happens to you. Listening is something you choose to do.

quiz.question: What percentage of what we hear do studies say we retain?
